Journal.Title: Brazilian journal of microbiology : [publication of the Brazilian Society for Microbiology]

Article.ArticleTitle: Gaseous ozone and ozonized mist in the control of Escherichia coli on 'Rama Forte' persimmon.

AbstractText: This study aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of using two ozone applications (gaseous and mist) as a disinfection method for fresh persimmon. To test these sanitizers, in vitro and in vivo assays were performed, and the Escherichia coli was selected because it is a pathogen that causes foodborne diseases in humans. For in vitro experiments, a plate was inoculated with Escherichia coli strain ATCC 25922 and treated. For in vivo assays, persimmon fruit surface was inoculated with the bacteria and treated. For both assays, it was used 10,15,20,30,40 and 50 μL L<sup>-1</sup> of gaseous ozone or ozonized mist for five minutes. The results demonstrated that the gas ozone application significantly reduced the growth of E. coli on the plate surface in vitro at doses of 30, 40 and 50 μL L<sup>-1</sup> (with 0.83, 0.89 and 0.95 log CFU mL<sup>-1</sup>, respectively). The application of ozonized mist showed a significant reduction for 50 μL L<sup>-1</sup> (with 1.28 log CFU g<sup>-1</sup>). And, for the in vivo assays, ozonized mist significantly reduced the number of bacteria on the persimmon surface, with a 1.57 log reduction, which was the largest for 40 μL L<sup>-1</sup>. Therefore, it is possible to conclude that the ozone application can contribute to the control of microorganisms present on fruit surfaces.
